content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="R of t, equals, 41 times the square root of the fraction t over 20, end root, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than 20; R of t, equals, the fraction with numerator 100 times t squared, plus 1000, and denominator t squared, plus 600, end fraction, for t greater than or equal to 20."><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mn>41</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1000</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The total accumulated revenue a company has received up to time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is modeled by the function <math alttext="R"><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></math> defined above, where <math alttext="R of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in millions of United States dollars and <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the time in years since 1980.

(a)   Find <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, R of t"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Explain the meaning of <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, R of t"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="R of t, equals, 41 times the square root of the fraction t over 20, end root, for 0 less than or equal to t, less than 20; R of t, equals, the fraction with numerator 100 times t squared, plus 1000, and denominator t squared, plus 600, end fraction, for t greater than or equal to 20."><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left"><mtr><mtd><mn>41</mn><msqrt><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msqrt></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>100</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1000</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>600</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mrow><mtext>for</mtext><mspace width="0.45em"></mspace><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

The total accumulated revenue a company has received up to time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is modeled by the function <math alttext="R"><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></math> defined above, where <math alttext="R of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in millions of United States dollars and <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the time in years since 1980.

(a)   Find <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, R of t"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Explain the meaning of <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, R of t"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> in the context of the problem.

(b)   Is the function <math alttext="R"><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></math> continuous at <math alttext="t equals 20"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Justify your answer.

(c)   The company’s total accumulated expenses up to time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is modeled by the function <math alttext="E"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="E of t equals, 3 times the log with base 2, of open parenthesis, 12 t plus 4, close parenthesis"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mi>log</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>12</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="E of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in millions of United States dollars and <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the time in years since 1980. According to these models, is there a time <math alttext="t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 5"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which the total accumulated profit, <math alttext="R of t, minus, E of t"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>E</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, is equal to 0 ? Justify your answer.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Confirm whether hypotheses or conditions of a selected definition, theorem, or test have been satisfied.
